column5: I've seen many offers from you to people on the board even if you didn't know them. That speaks volumes about you..A little Nova Scotia blood doesn't hurt either!!  Craig

Excellent read Peter.  My Dad was WWII vet and believed in tough love but had a heart of gold.  Some of your post reminds me of him.  I didn't understand a lot of the time where he was coming from but I sure do now that I am a father.  Jim
Thanks for the morning read with my coffee.
THANKS!!
THANKS!!!
THANKS!!
THANKS!!
The pleasure has always been mine!!
Nothing I guess Im kind of actually liking it on my head!
Anytime...... the bird is still a go by the way just be paitent!
The short answer is yes and VERY PROUD OF IT!
Shhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!
fishing fishing fishing fishing fishing and then some.....the only true equilizer/tranquilizer!!!!!
Almost didnt get the nerve to hit the send button...THANKS!!
Returned!!!!
Use to love going to Rosie Roads and tying it on with the Bee's maybe even a side trip to the "BLACK ANGUS" we will talk
Other end of the island actually  43°28'6.02"N   65°38'0.76"W
THANKS it was tough!!!!

Yeah,  I think it would be a bit nerve-wracking to hit the send button, but I'm glad you did.  Thanks for sharing, Peter -- that kind of openness cannot help but improve the lives of everyone who reads it.
Don't call me Mister I work for a living(lol)
You can come over tonight and get it if you want say deal applies!!!!!
THANKS!!
The feeling is mutual!!!
Well now what do I say to you...............Love You Brother!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Good having folks like you around Pete !!     Oh yes, brings back wonderful memories from the 60's ......and a few bad ones too
Thanks Lew!!!!!!! every so often I swear I can smell it!
Talk about increasing your post count!!  Good to read about your life Pete, everyone should bare their sole ( mispelled intentionally) on the board.

Aww, now ain't that sweet Peter  Very nice read and you have and always will be a valued member of this board.  It has been a pleasure to know you and I look forward to our many future get togethers.  Are we doing Venison Stew again this year?      That was awesome stuff.  Joey

great read peter  am i wrong in thinking that you are or were on the TOWARF crew? i thouhght i read that in a previous post.  if thats true, thank you... and all the people on that crew.  i have never needed the assistance they provide, but many do, and not many step up.  i see the boat in and out of the harbour alot during the summer, as i live in bronte as well and spend alot of time out on the pier, fishing, reading, or just sitting out there enjoying the sounds and sights of the harbour (its unfortunate its changing so much)  i, as well, am just drawn to the water it seems  great read again... good going  ryan
Whew, I am sooo releived, I had you figured out to be an ax murderer!!!
You forgot to add fishing  in between each number one to eight,
That is a biography that should be published! Very well written! Thanks for sharing it with us.
I salute you!   I mean that in a good way, not my usual flip comments
Nice read bud,we could be brothers,the water thing,the Navy thing(I was a Seabee),the charter thing,the 100% thing.We should talk more this year at Laikair. Joe
That was a good read! What part of Cape Bretton is your family from?
Nice to meet you Mr. Fairweather  Sinker
Great read Peter

Thanks for the insight Peter... I too have seen his kindness, for the BOQ G2G he offered myself and another board member his boat for the weekend, with two full tanks of gas and said "If you pay me, I will take it as an insult" the kind of people this world needs more of.
Excellent read!! It's a pleasure to meet you Peter!

Very well written Pete.I remember it like it was only yesterday.And I do agree Pete has a big herat and will go out of his way to help anyone espescialy family and close friends.And I am very proud to be one of Peters close friends.Way to go brother. Dan
THANKS!!

Thank you for allowing us into your life Peter. Reading your autobiography brought smiles, a tear and lots of respect. Hope that we get the opportunity to chat more this year.  By the way what part of Yorkshire is your Dad from?  J...
THANKS!!! 7 is good
